It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and compact growth habit. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest understories where it forms dense, low-lying mats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Verdesmum menglaense is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
